Blunder.  QxPf7# (that little hash mark or pound sign means check mate).  The bishop protects the queen against KxQ.  The black king has nowhere to move.  Here black can interpose the bishop, or the knight @ d7 or c6.  I recommend the bishop.

This move was unwise.  White will almost certainly interpose the bishop, meaning the black queen will have to move.  She cannot position herself to protect Bg4, and NxNf6+ lets white win QxBg4 for free.
White's mistake gives black only a tiny reprieve.  Here black should probably play NxNd5, since Be7 is completely undefended.
...or this.  This doesn't prevent NxNf6+, BxNf6, QxBg4 (for free) however.
